intro: Ardisia suishaensis, commonly known as the Suisha beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. Following flowering, it bears bright red berries that are visually striking and attract various wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
